definition: to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
as/as if/such as
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: Maybe you have to face a mountain of work every day.
sentences.chinese: 或許你每天必須面對堆積如山的工作。

sentences.english: They carted away the mountains of rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 他們用車子把堆積如山的垃圾運走了。

sentences.english: Even if such life the wealth piles up is also the eye mist.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的人生即便財富堆積如山也不過是過眼雲煙。

sentences.english: The girl went to the sink, and began to wash the dishes that were piled up there.
sentences.chinese: 女孩開始去洗碗池洗那些堆積如山的碗筷。

sentences.english: Perishable goods are piling up at the docks because of the strike of tally clerks.
sentences.chinese: 因理貨員罷工，碼頭上易腐爛的貨物堆積如山。

sentences.english: Many ancient civilisations piled up mountains of garbage.
sentences.chinese: 許多古代文明都留下了堆積如山的垃圾。

sentences.english: Building materials are piled up mountain-high on the construction site.
sentences.chinese: 工地上建築材料堆積如山。

sentences.english: Think of your debt as a small hill of dirt in your back yard.
sentences.chinese: 想想你所欠的債就像你家後院堆積如山的垃圾。

sentences.english: Perishable goods are piling up at the docks.
sentences.chinese: 碼頭上易腐爛的貨物堆積如山。

sentences.english: The paper spools pile up on the floor like giant tagliatelle.
sentences.chinese: 捲紙在地板上堆積如山，好像一條巨長的意大利粉條。

definition: morgue
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
in good condition/undamaged/intact
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
circuit box
a remote and desolate place
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
to resell
window with an iron grating (apartment etc)/barred window of a prison cell
to dig a mine/mining
sanitation
fence/paling
